intro: Senecio farkharensis, commonly known as the Farkhar Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to dry conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
